tweet: We are about to begin our first Spring Town Hall, follow along at  https://flores.house.gov/liveforum/

Looking forward to tonight’s Town Hall for our Northern Counties (Falls, Freestone, Leon, Limestone, McLennan, Milam & Robertson). The event will start a 6:30PM CT. You can watch on   http://flores.house.gov/liveforum , or call in to 1-877-229-8493 & use 111954 for the access code.

It was an honor to join the National Champion @BaylorWBB on their visit to the @WhiteHouse. Thank you @POTUS for hosting such a memorable event. (Official White House Photo by Joyce N. Boghosian) pic.twitter.com/dux5iv9prL – at The White House

There was a great turnout at the toy and family needs drive to support those affected by the tornado in Franklin. It is inspiring to see our community come together to support those in need. pic.twitter.com/O3BfVsJEAy

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to William P. Workman, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Army during the Vietnam Conflict. pic.twitter.com/PHZsev2wtu

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Penrod Sims Thornton, of College Station, who served in the U.S. Air Force during the Vietnam Conflict. pic.twitter.com/9Y81Pq2Yeq
I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Jerry “Kean” Register, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Army from 1985-2017. pic.twitter.com/fN4HABRMjB

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to David Christopher Ray, of Franklin, who served in the U.S. Air Force during Operation Enduring Freedom and Operation Iraqi Freedom. pic.twitter.com/NyO64tmNZH

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Thomas Gayle Powell, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Navy during the Vietnam Conflict. pic.twitter.com/HWfEzVMPxK
I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Terrence Nunn, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Army during Operation Desert Storm. pic.twitter.com/mbW5nqASKd
I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Henry W. Menefee, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Navy during World War II. pic.twitter.com/PlKFQffPbN

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Craig George, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Army, during Operation Iraqi Freedom. It was great to have Mr. George’s 4th grade class participate in the presentation. pic.twitter.com/J0nq1Djg2c

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Les Davenport, of Rockdale, who served in the U.S. Army during the Vietnam Conflict. pic.twitter.com/Ozt27vqfK4
I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Eric Eugene Dotson, of College Station, who served in the U.S. Army from 1992-1996. pic.twitter.com/1B5JGJ5NR4

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Dr. Aaron Keith Buzzard, of Bryan, who served in the U.S. Army during Operation Iraqi Freedom. pic.twitter.com/joxYbawSXN

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Olivia W. Burnside, of College Station, who served in the U.S. Marine Corps from 1974-1987. pic.twitter.com/zfcwtJPfUL

I was honored to be able to present the 2018 TX-17 Congressional Veteran Commendation to Robert L. Beal, of College Station, who served in the U.S. Marine Corps during World War II and the Korean War. pic.twitter.com/yrPZzaqxDS

It was an honor to present the Hoeffner family with the Purple Heart Medal that was posthumously awarded to Thomas E. Webb, their grandfather. Thomas Webb served during WWI and was seriously wounded during the Battle of Argonne Forrest in the Meuse-Argonne Campaign of WWI. pic.twitter.com/7ewai5i4bb

It was an honor to present George and Nettie Green with the Purple Heart Medal that was awarded posthumously to Paul Kurtz, Nettie’s father. Paul Kurtz served during WWI until he was severely injured and honorably discharged in 1919. pic.twitter.com/Kaf1XuPfD1

Today is Aggie Muster. A yearly event where Aggies gather to remember, honor and celebrate the lives of all fallen Aggies in the last year. Aggies all over the world answer "Here" for those lost. https://muster.tamu.edu/
